mapotempo.com.mapotempo_fleet_android

Class LoginFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • Fragment
      • mapotempo.com.mapotempo_fleet_android.LoginFragment

  • public class LoginFragment
extends Fragment
    Responsible for establish a connection with the library that allow you to get access to Mapotempo models. The fragment launch a connection attempt that give you, in some cases, a manager. The manager allow you to get access to the following entities :
    • Missions
    • User
    • Mission Status
    • Company
    Integration

    As a Fragment you must implement it in your XML file through the following line of code : <fragment class="mapotempo.com.mapotempo_fleet_android.LoginFragment" />

    This fragment require the implementation of LoginFragment.OnLoginFragmentImplementation directly in the Activity that hold the Login Fragment. You will have to implement the LoginFragment.OnLoginFragmentImplementation.onLoginFragmentImplementation(MapotempoFleetManagerInterface.OnServerConnexionVerify.Status, TimerTask, String[], MapotempoFleetManager) which will be called by an async task. If the library doesn't respond then, a timeout will stop the attempt and give the user back to the login page. As you'ill need to use the manager during the whole life cycle of the application, we highly recommend to keep a reference to it in a descendant of Application.

    Example: 
     public void onLoginFragmentImplementation(MapotempoFleetManagerInterface.OnServerConnexionVerify.Status status, TimerTask task, String[] logs) {
      task.cancel();

      switch (status) {
         case VERIFY:
              if (logs != null)
                  keepTraceOfConnectionLogsData(logs);
              MapotempoApplication mapotempoApplication = (MapotempoApplication) getApplicationContext();
              mapotempoApplication.setManager(manager);
              onBackPressed();
              finish();
              break;
          case LOGIN_ERROR:
              LoginFragment loginFragment = (LoginFragment) getSupportFragmentManager().findFragmentById(R.id.hook_login_fragment);
              loginFragment.toogleLogginView(false);
              AlertMessageHelper.errorAlert(this, null, R.string.login_error_title, R.string.login_error_short_text, R.string.login_error_details);
              break;
      }
 }
